item.title: Setup jenkins in docker container with nginx as reverse proxy
item.description: Install, enable, start nginx Link to heading I believe not every single piece of code we write today has to run in a docker container. So we’re gonna just use the “classic” nginx. $ sudo apt install nginx $ sudo systemctl enable nginx.service $ sudo systemctl start nginx.service Get a TLS certificate from letsencrypt Link to heading Install the letsencrypt certbot tool $ sudo apt-get update $ sudo apt-get install software-properties-common $ sudo add-apt-repository universe $ sudo add-apt-repository ppa:certbot/certbot $ sudo apt-get update $ sudo apt-get install certbot Get a certificate:
